intro: Thela alba, commonly known as the white thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and pale white to pale blue flowers that bloom in summer. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its composite flower heads. Thela alba has a robust root system and is drought-tolerant, making it adaptable to dry environments. Its leaves are typically spiny, providing a natural defense against herbivores.
